issue.title: Relative pose of collisions may be incorrect until Reset World

message.raw:
Nate said that there would probably be a problem with static objects based on the code I submitted. I checked, and indeed there was. I've attached another world file `spheres_hokuyo.xml` to test this issue.

In the default or gazebo_1.3 branches, you would see the [behavior shown in this video](https://vimeo.com/54553361). Three spheres should fall, but one behaves strangely (the one with a non-zero pose value in the collision element).

A video was also created for the [issue_264_1.4 branch](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/issue_264_1.4..default), which [shows that the behavior of the spheres is fixed, but that a problem with static objects is introduced](https://vimeo.com/54553358). Initially, the collision of the bookcase does match the desired position, though a `Reset World` fixes it. Also, using the Move or Rotate tool on the bookcase fixes it.

Nate said that there would probably be a problem with static objects based on the code I submitted. I checked, and indeed there was. I've attached another world file spheres_hokuyo.xml to test this issue.

In the default or gazebo_1.3 branches, you would see the behavior shown in this video. Three spheres should fall, but one behaves strangely (the one with a non-zero pose value in the collision element).

A video was also created for the issue_264_1.4 branch, which shows that the behavior of the spheres is fixed, but that a problem with static objects is introduced. Initially, the collision of the bookcase does match the desired position, though a Reset World fixes it. Also, using the Move or Rotate tool on the bookcase fixes it.
